wikipedia_page.main: Ayisha Malik is a British author. Her debut novel Sofia Khan is Not Obliged was published in 2015. The sequel, The Other Half of Happiness, was published in 2017. Malik was a consultant for Nadiya Hussain's novel The Secret Lives of the Amir Sisters.

response: *Ayisha Malik, British writer of Pakistani descent

Hussain released her first novel, The Secret Lives of the Amir Sisters, in January 2017 with help from author Ayisha Malik and was billed as a British Muslim take on Little Women. A review published in The Guardian by Jenny Colgan sparked a fierce backlash on social media after Colgan questioned whether Hussain "really need to put her name to a novel, too, when there's only so much shelf space to go around?" and accused Hussain of being "greedy".

Sofia Khan is Not Obliged is the first fictional work by Ayisha Malik. The text was published by Twenty7 Books in 2015 and is a romance fiction that explores the trials and tribulations of dating as a young Muslim woman living in London.
